Package game.behaviour

Class HuntingBehaviour

java.lang.Object
game.behaviour.HuntingBehaviour
All Implemented Interfaces:
Behaviour
public class HuntingBehaviour
extends java.lang.Object
implements Behaviour
Implements a hunting behaviour that is used by Allosaurs to hunt and attack other dinosaurs
Version:
7.0.0
Author:
Tim Jordan, Enoch Leow
See Also:
Allosaur, FindNearestLocation

  • Constructor Details

    • HuntingBehaviour

      Constructor

  • Method Details

    • getAction

      public Action getAction​(Actor actor, GameMap map, Actions actions)
      Tries to find/attack a suitable food source around it's vicinity. If not able to find one around it will find and go to the nearest food source.
      Specified by:
      getAction in interface Behaviour
      Parameters:
      actor - the Actor acting
      map - the GameMap containing the Actor
      actions - an Actions object that determines the surrounding actions available
      Returns:
      an Action instance that denotes the action the actor can currently do
      See Also:
      Actor.playTurn(Actions, Action, GameMap, Display)

    • getFollowBehaviour

      private Behaviour getFollowBehaviour​(Actor actor, GameMap map, java.util.ArrayList<Actor> preys, java.util.ArrayList<Location> foodLocations)
      Initialises a FollowBehaviour class object that follows the closest suitable food source for actor
      Parameters:
      actor - An Actor class object
      map - a GameMap object that is the current game map the actor is in
      preys - an Array list of Actors that the Dinosaur can attack
      foodLocations - an Array list of Locations that contain suitable food items
      Returns:
      a Behaviour class object that the actor will follow
